content:
Draft and Save Knowledge Articles with Generative AI

You can draft a knowledge article via a quick action on the Case page or from the Knowledge component. Edit and save your new article, and then submit it for approval and publishing.

Available in: Lightning Experience, Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Service add-on.
User permissions needed:
Einstein Knowledge Creation permission set
Knowledge User
Manage Articles
Publish Articles

To draft an article, select Draft Knowledge Article from the Case page or use the New Article button in the Knowledge component. Einstein considers different data depending on the starting page.

If you start from the Case page, it uses Live Chat Transcripts and Messaging sessions.
If you have Service AI Grounding set up, it includes case emails and comments.
For Messaging and Chat channels, it only uses the current conversation.

You can draft articles in multiple languages: English, French, Italian, German, Japanese, and Spanish. Select a record type, title, language, and customize the URL before generating the article.

Articles appear as plain text; review, edit, and save them as a draft. If a field can't be filled, Einstein leaves it blank or shows Not Specified. The agent can add missing information and then save the article.

After saving, agents with Publish permission review and publish the article from Knowledge. View published articles from the case's related tab or search in your knowledge base.

Drafting with Einstein cuts down on growing your knowledge base effort, but requires an approval process to ensure accuracy and quality.
title: Drafting Knowledge Articles with Generative AI in Service Cloud
